top_comment.text: wait...what 'would' happen if a Black hole actually meets a Supernova?﻿
top_comment.author: Xazergamer

comments.text:
Oh nothing, just an explosion in deep space that would roast everything 
around it for a couple thousand light years then be sucked into a force of 
gravity so strong time and space cannot function. No biggie.
comments.author: Gabe Ritter

comments.text:
A black hole isn't actually a "hole". It's just a very dense space of 
matter. Pretty much ... gravity en mass. The more mass it sucks in, the 
stronger the gravity gets. So basically, if the scenario you mentioned 
would happen, the black hole would first suck in all the particles sent out 
by the supernova and then the supernova itself, becoming even more dense in 
matter and even stronger in gravity.
comments.author: Baghnal

top_comment.text:
Hey people, here I did a recount of how is the game going (remember, it is 
K/D/A): 
Dire team: Enigma - 1/2/6, Tidehunter - 1/2/4, Crystal Maiden - 3/3/1, 
Phoenix - 3/3/6, Terrorblade - 2/0/1. All the 1st towers are destroyed.
Radiant team: Axe - 2/2/0, Juggernaut - 1/2/2, Timbersaw - 4/3/3, Kunkka - 
2/3/3, Rubick - 1/3/3. Only 1st top tower destroyed (actaully, denied).

 There are things that I just had to made up, like in this episode when 
enigma and phoenix ulti who gets wich kill and wich assist, or when terror 
kills juggernaut in the jungle if phoenix actually killed or not rubick, 
but i think it's pretty accurate.﻿

comments.text:
At level 1 if he takes metamorphosis, does 70 damage, has good attack speed 
and great base attack time, and has 7 armour. Lvl 2 he makes an image that 
deals 30% of that damage, and lvl 3 he gets a 60% slow that lasts 2.5 
seconds and makes an un-targetable illusion that attacks the victim. There 
are not many heroes out there that are scarier then that in a 1v1 
situation. (saying that neither have any items, or the same items.)
comments.author: kriskorp

comments.text:
Going straight to BoT as TB is really risky, unless you're snowballing 
really hard (though it does help his pushing a lot). I build tread on him 
because it grants you some stat on demand, which is good for early fights. 
Medu's ult is a very good one, but in the early game you'll want to use it 
to get out of a gank more than to contribute to team clash. That's the 
biggest problem to Medu, imo. She has to either go for damage items (crit, 
maelstrom,etc.), which then will reduce her survivality, or go for 
defensive items (linken, most of the time) and therefore lack the needed 
damage output. TB is a much more straightforward in item choice, since Meta 
+ illus give him insane damage dps. I agree with you that TB has big 
trouble with nukes and disable, but that fact can apply for almost 90% 
heroes, right :) ? Medu wont fight the enemies alone, even with her ult up 
(and Medu is obviously not strong in 1v1, she shines in 5v5 clash), so does 
TB. So my point is, if they have to fight in the early game, TB is the 
better fighter and less item-dependant :)
comments.author: Đức Lê

comments.text:
+Đức Lê TB is one of the best heroes for me and i have 70+% win rate 

and tread isn't good for him 
you need that travel boots to push until you are ready for fights 
and i do play on medusa a lot too 
she is money hungry hero as what i said before 
but she is much better in early game fights because of her ult 

while TB is very squishy hero not against physical damage 
but against magic and disables and thats why you will try to avoid fights 
until you get that BKB then you can deal some serious damage

at least this is how i play him and i win a lot by this build-style
comments.author: someone

comments.text:
I have quite a bit experience with TB, so I can say TB is not really that 
squishy early game. As he's an illusion-based carries, TB players will 
build a lot of stat items for him. For me, I often goes for Aquila + Tread 
+ Drum build, and often get those at 9-12 mins (since you're the hard 
carries, and get more farm in the laning stage, this would be pretty 
normal). His strength growth is low, but not the lowest in the game, and 
the high base armor can more or less make up for it (still vulnerable to 
heavy nukes, but lets face it, almost all agi carries have the same 
problem). Medusa, on the other hand, have to choose either survival ability 
(mana shield, which is actually not that good without some raw mana/mana 
regen items) or laning presence (mystic snake) - cause no one will level up 
splitshot when they dont have damage yet. My point is, TB is less 
item-dependant than Medusa, and have better early presence :)
comments.author: Đức Lê

comments.text:
But I disagree with medusa, in pubs she is much stronger than tb imo, since 
the buffs she's gotten she can get absurdly tanky, and mana snake is 
ridiculously good in games where people just eat it, which for me is all of 
them if I time them right, with just a basi you can almost cast it every 
time it's off cd from level 3 onwards. Terrorblade kinda is easy to counter 
with more heroes, yes medusa is hard countered by nyx or antimage but 
terror can be countered by any AoE plus battlefury carriers. But I don't 
know enough to care and I suck at tb anyway, even more than morphling.
comments.author: Joel Mahon

comments.text:
+Joel Mahon it is 
but in early game you mostly use it to push 

because even if you use your 3rd ability and gain 80+ damage , you still 
have 1k or maybe less HP (depends in your build) 
so you can't do a lot once they stun you and focus you 
and you are slower so its harder to run from the fight than what it used to 
be ( i know its not a big deal to lose 25 movement speed but trust me it 
does effect your jukes mostly )

most of us play terror as pushing hero for 20-30min until you take down all 
the t1 and 2 or all the t2 towers 
after that you will get enough gold to get big items to fight

witch isn't good option in early game because they will stun you or nuke

and medusa can be much more useful with her ult in any match stage , early

but terror due to his low HP pool , he can't even use his ult in many cases

so i guess terror still need more gold than her

captions.text: NIGEL: Hello and welcome to a new Dota 2 Report.
It's been fun as part of the Dire team so far.
We had a rough fight in the middle lane.
But meanwhile, Terrorblade seems to be farming just fine.
ENIGMA: Hey, Terrorblade,
most heroes use their Helm of the Dominator to...
help stack the Ancient creep camp.
...rather than..
whatever it is you're doing.
TERRORBLADE: Haha no that sounds like too much effort.
ENIGMA: sigh... At this rate I'm never gonna finish my blink dagger.
CM: Blink Dagger!
ENIGMA: 'Blink dagger' !
Hey Crystal Lady, if I buy some wards can you carry them?
I don't have too much space.
CM: No.
ENIGMA: You know what? I can't even be mad at you.
Arcane Aura is like the best thing in the universe.
NIGEL: What should we do now?
I'm unable to make decisions by myself and have no intuition as to what to do. At all.
TIDEHUNTER: We need wards!
ENIGMA: I've got your wards right here!
Really, I do.
Nigel and I will ward the bottom river area.
Tidehunter, I'll give you a ward to place near our jungle.
SHIT
I don't even like wards!
F*** wards, right!?
It's not like we would take advantage of the vision they granted anyway!
Ha ha HA ha we're terrib-
Okay bye. >:|
TIDEHUNTER: Look, Timbersaw!
Not real Timbersaw?
CM: Illusion.
TIDEHUNTER: Illusion again?
Yup!
Where in the world is Timbersaw?
TIMBERSAW: Incoming!
TERRORBLADE: Aaargh!
Ugh, you again!
TIMBERSAW: Very perceptive.
You stand NO chance. Not when I have my Bloodstone!
TERRORBLADE: That's what YOU think!
TIMBERSAW: Yes it is!
TERRORBLADE: Get a load of this!
TIMBERSAW: Oh yeah I forgot he had that ability.
I hadn't seen him use it yet.
TIDEHUNTER: Tidehunter help kill real Timbersaw!
TIMBERSAW: Not if I kill me first! Ha HA!
TERRORBLADE: DAMMIT!
ENIGMA: Well that takes care of Timbersaw at least.
But where is the rest of their team?
NIGEL: I haven't seen most of them on the minimap in awhile.
ENIGMA: Hey you know what this feels like?
This is like one of those times where you sort of think,
"Hay maybe their at Roshan?"
...And then it turns out they actually are
and then you realize it 4 seconds too late...
*Axe was just killed by Roshan!*
ENIGMA: HA!
KUNKKA: Dibs on the Aegis!
JUGGERNAUT: No! It belongs to Juggernaut.
RUBICK: This was such a bad idea.
KUNKKA: The Aegis shall be mine! Continue on!
JUGGERNAUT: I do not wish to tank the damage.
KUNKKA: Agh nor do I!
RUBICK: Someone needs to take the damage! This was your idea, Kunkka.
KUNKKA: My health is too low.
RUBICK: This was a bad idea :(
KUNKKA: Juggernaut, go ahead.
RUBICK: This was a BAD idea...
JUGGERNAUT: No! no.
KUNKKA: That... smarts.
ENIGMA: BLACK HOOOO-
NIGEL: Super no-
-OOOOOOOOOLLEEE!!!!!!!!!!!!
ENIGMA: That was a bit overkill.
But totally worth it!
NIGEL: I agree.
ENIGMA: This doesn't feel right. Something negative needs to happen
to make up for this overwhelmingly positive event.
ANNOUNCER: Dire's middle tower has fallen.
ENIGMA: There we go.
ROSHAN: *Thank you so much*
*Thank you for disposing of those intruders.*
*They appeared out of nowhere with the intent to murder me.*
*But now thanks to you I can go back to building my cheese shop.*
*Here's a coupon for free cheese during the Grand Opening.*
*Again, thank you. Have a nice day.*
ENIGMA: Let's kill him!

title: The DOTA 2 Reporter Ep. 50: Grave Gravity
